Welcome to spheres’s documentation!¶

toolbox for higher spin and symmetrization!

Implementation of the “Majorana stars” formalism.

spheres.stars.c_xyz(z, pole='south')[source]¶

Stereographic projection from the extended complex plane to the unit sphere.

Given coordinate \(z=x+iy\) or \(\infty\), returns \((0,0,-1)\) if \(z = \infty\), otherwise:

\[(\frac{2x}{1+x^2+y^2}, \frac{2y}{1+x^2+y^2}, \frac{1-x^2-y^2}{1+x^2+y^2})\]
Parameters

  • c (complex or inf) – Point on the extended complex plane.

  • pole (str, default 'south') – Whether to project from the North or South pole.

Returns

XYZ coordinates.

Return type

np.ndarray

spheres.stars.xyz_c(xyz, pole='south')[source]¶

Reverse Stereographic projection from the unit sphere to the extended complex plane.

Given \((0,0,-1)\), returns \(\infty\). Otherwise:

\[z = (\frac{x}{1+z}) + i(\frac{y}{1+z})\]
Parameters

  • xyz (np.ndarray) – Point on the unit sphere.

  • pole (str, default 'south') – Whether to reverse project from the North or South pole.

Returns

Extended complex coordinate.

Return type

complex or inf
